page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 21 Decem
b
To M
r
Secretary from M
r
Bodly
What is intended by
e Magistrats of
Utrecht
wee
I
cannot come to und
r
stand but they have resolved
&
e speeche goeth that they have putt yt already
in execution to depose theyr 4 ministers or at
e
least 2 of
em from theyr function. they have
often attempted heertofore, but by int
r
cession of
e
counsell of State
they have forborn, yt is thought
now
e f[.] & such oth
r
as yo
r
H. hath und
r
stood
heertofor to have bin banished the Towne do take an
opportunity to bee revenged. the cause w
ch
they
p
r
tend of theyr
ceeding is for
t
those ministers
continew affected to
Devent
r
& his faction for I
thinke some of th
e
of late have publickly noted
the chiefe magistrat to bee of no religion in
theyr sermons to
e people,
Count Maurice
&
e
States of Holland
have sent 2 oth
r
ministers of
thes
tes unto
em to
suade
em to an atonement
but there ys small hope of any good to theyr
endevour, so as many men fear yt will prove
a p
r
paration to a great deale of furder trouble
& in
e end a defection to
e Ennemy. Dece
m
21.
